Html:
How would I go about opening an access database using the .OpenDatabase() method and supplying the password?

DAO.Database existingDatabase = accessApplication.DBEngine.Workspaces[0].OpenDatabase(documentFile);

hello there,

OpenDatabase works with the database typical connection string.
very common is:

DBEngine.Workspaces(0).OpenDatabase("documentFile", false, false, ";pwd=myPassword")

*happy coding
Sebastian

Sebastian,

Thank you for the quick reply. I will pass those args in the constructor. Also, do you have documentation on the API for the various classes and methods?

Sent from my iPhone

NetOffice is an 1:1 Wrapper to the original Microsoft API there you know from VBA or Interop. you can use the local help files(*.chm) or microsoft online documentation. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/office/aa905369.aspx

as i start with NetOffice i think about delivering office developer documentation with NetOffice releases but its not allowed.
"Redistribution of any content or parts of content is strictly prohibited"
- from the ms licence agreement

for questions you can use the NetOffice discussion board(i'm happy to help any time) or one of the limitless office developer boards, specialy the ms-online discussion board for office.
http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/office/forum

*happy coding
Sebastian
